Posts.Content: Hi T10 i had a masectomy and lymph removal in Feb, so slightly different op, but found some bras in Asda (post surgery ones) which were soft and minimal seems... not too bad £££ wise either, might be worth a look? i did live in vest tops as well though with the support in (m&s)  and still do so now some days!  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Bras!!!

Posts.Content: Hi,  Ive got my first oncology appointment on Wednesday this week after being  ‘signed of’ by my Breast care consultant... can anyone give me an indication of what to expect at the first appointment?  Thansk in advance...
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thank you Rosie! wow they moved quickly then if you had first one the next day! Thank you so much for sharing your experience..aware that other hospitals might be different.  I was told 2-3 weeks after appt I’d get first chemo... but they said that about this first appointment which has come through a week later!  No no doubt I’ll be back with more questions that I didn’t ask at the time....
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi princess betty im5 1/2 week post  op now.. was just walking   & a little gentle jog today  ... felt good to get back there but the gym has a nice view  over a park...  need to start building it up a bit but chemo starting soon x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: First post on this thread... but feeling an achievement today- back at the gym today for the first time post mastectomy and lymph gland removal (with nurse ok to!)... 20min walking on the  treadmill overlooking a park on sUnny day and feeling good after it need to keep this going....
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: I love that Robbie song Maz.. listens to it so much and words have a new meaning to them since this lovely diagnosis... it’s my ‘Go to song’ at the moment.....  big hugs xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer the gift that keeps giving!

Posts.Content: Well no. 2 done yesterday...25% of way through it.. 50% with the EC.  Felt a bit nauseous this morning so was awake at 1, and not slept since. Trying to stay awake now so I get some sleep tonight!
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: I’m in well n truly this month.. first session last Friday... absolutely shattered...  but trying to do a little more each day!  The positives... no sickness and no hair loss as yet... hoping cold cap works for me!
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi Haysie how are are you feeling today? I found it hit days 2-4 with tiredness... I am not in week 2 and feeling surprisingly well/ normal if a bit more tired than usual... but will be back to square one at the end of next week!!
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi puzzler thank you for the Tupperware idea.. brain obviousky isn’t functioning as taking an alternative container hasn’t even crossed my mind! Will do that.. many thanks!!
Posts.Title: sharps bin.. possibly silly question!

Posts.Content: Hi all i had my second cycle on Friday, and have to inject myself Tuesday -Saturday. The hospital gave me sharps bin after my first cycle, so it already has a couple of used needles in. However.. I’m going to stay with my parents next weekend- when I still need to do the injections. Can I close the flap/lid on the bin to stop the needles coming out, and reopen once I’m at my parents.. or is it a case of once it’s closed, that’s it, not to be re-opened? Many thanks! (Also pasted on chemo chat group but this one seems to be more active!)
Posts.Title: sharps bin.. possibly silly question!

Posts.Content: I’d suggest trying to get to the bottom of what is causing the stress.. is it work tasks, work environment, are you ready to be back at work etc... it maybe (as already suggested) that you need to talk to your manager, speak to occ health , if you have an employee assistance programme use that.... feel free to message me directly if you’d prefer, it’s a bit of a specialist area of mine x
Posts.Title: Stress at work after cancer

Posts.Content: Hi lisa id agree that the wait is unacceptable... lucky you having* health cover i as my go on jan 2, saw the consultant and mammogram etc the same day being told told it was l8kely.. and if the tests confirmed I would be having an operation on feb 14... which was when I had right masectomy and lymph nodes out. I then started chemo on March 29 so aware that I seemingly moved quickly.. based in Leicestershire.  Fingers crossed for you...
Posts.Title: Rant alert - feel free to ignore :-)

Posts.Content: Hi Londonmumof2 Sorry to hear your  news... one of of the things I really struggled with was telling my 2 daughters (15 &. 18]... I eventually decided that I wasn’t telling them anything until I had all the info etc... I wanted to be ab,e to answer their questions and not have to say I don’t know etc so I know how you feel.  Take me all the help that you can get/ are offfereed... one thing I’ve learnt on my journey is who your true friends are, rely on their support and take advantage of it. Unfortunately it’s opened my eyes, but I now have a strong group of friends I can really rely on and trust 110%. thebreast care nurses are fantastic as well, the knowledge etc is great, but also don’t forget people on here- we are note medical professionals but have been there done it a lot of the time, or will have an input, even if it’s just a virtual hug when needed... keep talking !!!!   Xx
Posts.Title: Two appointments now on Wednesday and Thursday for results?

Posts.Content: I’m in... I’m 25% of my way through my chemo, 50% of way through the EC treatment, then 4 docetaxel.  Only real side effects so far have been extreme tiredness in the first week, then seem to get to 75-80% back to normal.  Nect one on Friday .....
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**
